name: Fabián E. Bustamante
content: Fabián E. Bustamante (networking and distributed systems) Fabián E. Bustamante Professor Computer Science Northwestern University Director of Research Phenix RTS fabianb@... S. Mudd, 3509 2233 Tech Drive, 3rd Floor Evanston, IL USA 60208 1.847.491-2745 The principle of science, the definition, almost, is the following: The test of all knowledge is experiment. Experiment is the sole judge of scientific 'truth'. But what is the source of knowledge? Where do the laws that are to be tested come from? Experiment, itself, helps to produce these laws, in the sense that it gives us hints. Richard Feynman, The Feynman Lectures on Physics I conduct research on Internet-scale computer networks and distributed systems. My research approach is primarily experimental -- building and evaluating ideas in “the wild”. Much of my work focuses on improving the visibility of measurement on networked systems, leveraging this visibility to characterize them and the infrastructure they rely on, and designing new and improved systems based on the gained insight. As the forces shaping the Internet ecosystem are less purely technical, in recent years I have started to explore the interactions between pervasive networked systems and their broader context, from natural disaster, to political unrest and economics. more? What's New? I am always looking for good students interested in networked systems (distributed systems, networking, wired and mobile systems). Rashna will be presenting "Of Choices and Control - A Comparative Analysis of Government Hosting" at the ACM IMC 2024 in Madrid, Spain. Esteban presented our paper on "Ten years of the Venezuelan crisis - An Internet perspective" at SIGCOMM 2024 in beautiful Sydney. Walter Willinger and I co-organized an NSF Workshop focused on Internet Survivability. A fantastic, diverse group of participants and some great discussions. Two SIGMETRICS papers back to back, in 2023 looking at global threats towards consolidation and in 2024 on a study of intercontinental long-haul links as the network-layer manifestation of critical transoceanic undersea cables. Oldies but goodies ... Walter Willinger and I, with a lot of help from our co-organizers, run the first NSF workshop focused on Internet resilience and survivability. The report is available at the SIGCOMM CCR. Demand on Internet systems as a proxy for social distancing - read our cool IMC 2021 paper "Networked Systems as Witnesses - Association Between Content Demand, Human Mobility and an Infection Spread". A new on IPXs, a great collaboration with Andra Lutu and Diego Perino, from Telefonica Research, and Marcelo Bagnulo, from the Universidad Carlos III de Madrid will appear in ACM SIGCOMM 2021. Nick Feamster and I co-chaired the ACM Internet Measurement Conference 2020. Among the many changes we introduced to the review process, the use of a Review Task Force and Early Rejections seem to be popular and have been adopted by several other great conferences since. A great NSF/FCC workshop on tracking quality of experience in the Internet. The report from it is now available at the SIGCOMM CCR. An op-ed in Pacific Standard on Cuban Internet connectivity My op-ed on Forbes on the right to affordable broadband Blog Fabián E. Bustamante is a Professor of Computer Science at Northwestern University and Director of Research at Phenix, a Chicago-based startup specializing in real-time video streaming at scale. He earned his M.Sc. and Ph.D. in Computer Science from the Georgia Institute of Technology. Prior to that, he studied and taught at Universidad Nacional de La Patagonia San Juan Bosco (Argentina), where he earned both a 3-year and 5-year degree in computer science. His research interests span several areas of experimental systems, with a focus. His group has released numerous open-source systems, collectively used by over 1.5 million people. Fabián is a senior member of ACM and IEEE, and a recipient of the NSF CAREER award, multiple Google Faculty Research Awards, and the Science Foundation of Ireland’s E.T.S. Walton Visitor Award.
